content: Hello! Thanks for contacting XYZ Home Services. How can I help you today?
I need someone to fix a leak under my kitchen sink, it's getting worse. But I don't have much patience for nonsense. What can you do?
We can help with your leaking sink. May I please have your name to get started with booking your service?
Just call me Mr. Grant. I don't want my full name in any system, I'm tired of sharing details.
Understood, Mr. Grant. May I have your address to make sure you’re in our service area and send a plumber to your location?
You need my address now? Why can’t you just send someone? This feels like too many steps.
I understand it’s frustrating, but we need your address to confirm you’re within our service area and to dispatch the plumber. Once I have it, I can quickly help you with scheduling.
Fine, it's 791 Maple Lane. Don't ask me for anything else unless it's absolutely necessary.
Thank you, Mr. Grant. I’ll check to confirm we cover your area and then help you schedule your service.
We do service 791 Maple Lane. What day and time works best for our plumber to stop by?
I need it fixed today, but I can’t be waiting around all afternoon. Can you guarantee a time or is this going to be an all-day affair?
I’ll check our schedule for today and let you know our soonest available slot. Is there a specific time window that works best for you?
Between 1 and 3 pm. I better not be left waiting. And I want to know the price before anyone steps foot inside.
Thank you. I’ll check for plumber availability between 1 and 3 pm. I’ll also get you a price estimate for fixing the kitchen sink leak.
We have availability today between 1 and 3 pm. The typical charge for kitchen sink leak repairs ranges from $120 to $250, depending on the severity and parts needed. Does this work for you?
I’m not agreeing to anything until I know EXACTLY what the final cost is. I’ve been tricked before.

I understand your concern, Mr. Grant. We provide a firm quote after our plumber examines the leak in person, with no obligation to proceed. Would you like to schedule the visit for a quote between 1 and 3 pm?
So, you're telling me you can't give me a straight answer and I just have to hope for the best? Sounds like a waste of time.

We aim to be as transparent as possible, Mr. Grant. There’s no charge to have the plumber come by and quote the repair. Would you like to proceed with booking the 1–3 pm window, or do you prefer to hold off?
Forget it. I’ll see if someone else will give me a straight answer. Don’t contact me again.
reason: Customer declined to proceed and requested not to be contacted.
